page.title: 16KEEP IN TOUCH
page.content: We can get in touch with one another with Royal Mail.If you write a letter you then buy a stamp at the post-office.You may get in touch with people with a first class stamp which is seventeen pence or second class which is thirteen pence.First class should arrive the next day.But second class mail takes up to four days.You can send parcels.There is a post box on the wall near the post-office.The van collects twice a day.The mail van is red and has the Royal Crest on it.The most popular way to get in touch is to pick up the telephone and ring up.95% of the people have telephones in their homes.There are two kiosks in this area which be used by anyone as long as they have a supply of ten pence coins.Telephones are used for emergency calls,business calls and gossip calls.
